definition: to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct

sentences.english: Tommorrow is the memorial date of the foundind of Chinese Communist Party, but it's rarely reminded.
sentences.chinese: 明天是建党的纪念日，但几乎没有被提起。

sentences.english: In the hour that marks found a party 81 years, we are made up sent this group of articles.
sentences.chinese: 在纪念建党八十一周年的时刻，我们编发了这组文章。

sentences.english: Now, Han Sanping copied this mold to "Jian Dang Wei Ye".
sentences.chinese: 现在，韩三平又把这种模式复制到了《建党伟业》中。

sentences.english: Pyongyang, in front of Monument to the Founding of the Party, North Korea
sentences.chinese: 相片摄于朝鲜平壤，建党纪念碑前。

definition: Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
Xinhai Revolution (1911), which ended the Qing Dynasty
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
to found a country/nation-building/the foundation of PRC by Mao Zedong in 1949
Manifesto of the Communist Party/"Manifest der Kommunistischen Partei" by Marx and Engels (1848)
Zunyi conference of January 1935 before the Long March

pinyin: Xin1 Min2 zhu3 zhu3 yi4 Ge2 ming4

definition: United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
